content.query:
DROP TABLE [gold].[customer_dim]
CREATE TABLE [gold].[customer_dim]
(
 customer_id varchar(50),
 member_id VARCHAR(50),
 first_name varchar(50),
 last_name varchar(50),
 prm_status varchar(10),
 age INT,
 state varchar(30),
 country varchar(30)
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (customer_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO



CREATE TABLE [gold].[investor_dim]
(
 investor_id varchar(30),
 loan_funded_amount INT,
 investor_type varchar(50),
 age INT,
 state varchar(30),
 country varchar(30)
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (investor_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO

DROP TABLE [gold].[Loan_Details_Dim]
CREATE TABLE [gold].[Loan_Details_Dim] (
	loan_id varchar(30) not null,
	member_id VARCHAR(50),
	loan_amnt INT, 
	funded_amnt int, 
	term VARCHAR(30), 
	int_rate varchar(30), 
	installment DECIMAL(18, 2), 
	issue_d VARCHAR(50), 
	loan_status VARCHAR(50), 
	purpose VARCHAR(50), 
	title VARCHAR(50), 
	disbursement_method VARCHAR(50)
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (loan_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO


DROP TABLE [gold].[Account_Details_Dim]

CREATE TABLE [gold].[Account_Details_Dim] (
	account_id  VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	member_id VARCHAR(50),
	grade VARCHAR(50), 
	sub_grade VARCHAR(50), 
	emp_title VARCHAR(50) , 
	emp_length VARCHAR(50), 
	home_ownership VARCHAR(50), 
	annual_inc INT, 
	verification_status VARCHAR(50), 
	total_acc INT, 
	application_type VARCHAR(50), 
	annual_inc_joint INT,  
	verification_status_joint VARCHAR(50), 
	tot_hi_cred_lim INT
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (account_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO

CREATE TABLE [gold].[Fact_table] (
	id  INT,
	loan_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	customer_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	account_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	transaction_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	defaulter_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	investor_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
	loan_amnt INT
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO

 |-- transaction_id: string (nullable = false)
 |-- funded_amnt_inv: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- installment: decimal(18,2) (nullable = true)
 |-- total_pymnt: decimal(18,2) (nullable = true)
 |-- last_pymnt_d: string (nullable = true)
 |-- last_pymnt_amnt: decimal(18,2) (nullable = true)
 |-- next_pymnt_d: string (nullable = true)
 |-- disbursement_method: string (nullable = true)


DROP TABLE [gold].[Payment_Details_Dim]
CREATE TABLE [gold].[Payment_Details_Dim] (
	transaction_id  VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	member_id VARCHAR(50) ,
	funded_amnt_inv INT, 
	installment DECIMAL(18,2), 
	total_pymnt DECIMAL(18,2) , 
	last_pymnt_d VARCHAR(50), 
	last_pymnt_amnt DECIMAL(18,2), 
	next_pymnt_d VARCHAR(50), 
	disbursement_method VARCHAR(20)
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (transaction_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO



 |-- defaulter_id: string (nullable = false)
 |-- delinq_2yrs: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- inq_last_6mths: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- pub_rec: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- total_rec_late_fee: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- delinq_amnt: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- pub_rec_bankruptcies: integer (nullable = true)
 |-- hardship_flag: string (nullable = true)
 |-- hardship_type: string (nullable = true)
 |-- hardship_amount: string (nullable = true)
 |-- hardship_length: string (nullable = true)

DROP TABLE [gold].[Loan_Defaulter_Dim]
 CREATE TABLE [gold].[Loan_Defaulter_Dim] (
	defaulter_id VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	member_id VARCHAR(50), 
	delinq_2yrs INT, 
	inq_last_6mths INT,
	pub_rec INT,
	total_rec_late_fee INT,
	delinq_amnt INT,
	pub_rec_bankruptcies INT, 
	hardship_flag VARCHAR(20), 
	hardship_type VARCHAR(50), 
	hardship_amount VARCHAR(20),
	hardship_length VARCHAR(20)
)
WITH
(
    DISTRIBUTION = HASH (defaulter_id),
    CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX
)
GO

SELECT * FROM [gold].[customer_dim] ORDER BY customer_id DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT TOP 1 * FROM [gold].[customer_dim] ORDER BY customer_id DESC

select count(*) from [gold].[customer_dim]

CREATE TABLE gold.date_dim 
( date_key INT NOT NULL, 
date DATE NOT NULL, 
weekday VARCHAR(9) NOT NULL, 
weekday_num INT NOT NULL, 
day_month INT NOT NULL, 
day_of_year INT NOT NULL, 
week_of_year INT NOT NULL, 
iso_week CHAR(10) NOT NULL, 
month_num INT NOT NULL, 
month_name VARCHAR(9) NOT NULL, 
month_name_short CHAR(3) NOT NULL, 
quarter INT NOT NULL, 
year INT NOT NULL, 
first_day_of_month DATE NOT NULL, 
last_day_of_month DATE NOT NULL,
 yyyymm CHAR(7) NOT NULL, 
 weekend_indr CHAR(10) NOT NULL );

select count(*) from gold.date_dim
truncate table gold.date_dim

INSERT INTO gold.date_dim
SELECT CAST(CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), datum, 112) AS INT) AS date_key,
    datum AS date,
    DATENAME(WEEKDAY, datum) AS weekday,
    DATEPART(WEEKDAY, datum) AS weekday_num,
    DATEPART(DAY, datum) AS day_month,
    DATEPART(DAYOFYEAR, datum) AS day_of_year,
    DATEPART(WEEK, datum) AS week_of_year,
    CAST(DATEPART(ISO_WEEK, datum) AS VARCHAR(4)) + '-W' + CAST(DATEPART(WEEKDAY, datum) AS VARCHAR(1)) AS iso_week,
    DATEPART(MONTH, datum) AS month_num,
    DATENAME(MONTH, datum) AS month_name,
    LEFT(DATENAME(MONTH, datum), 3) AS month_name_short,
    DATEPART(QUARTER, datum) AS quarter,
    DATEPART(YEAR, datum) AS year,
    DATEADD(MONTH, DATEDIFF(MONTH, 0, datum), 0) AS first_day_of_month,
    EOMONTH(datum) AS last_day_of_month,
    CONCAT(YEAR(datum), '-', FORMAT(datum, 'MM')) AS yyyymm,
    CASE
        WHEN DATEPART(WEEKDAY, datum) IN (6, 7) THEN 'weekend'
        ELSE 'weekday'
    END AS weekend_indr
FROM (SELECT DATEADD(DAY, SEQUENCE.DAY, '2017-01-01') AS datum
    FROM (SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY (SELECT NULL)) - 1 AS DAY FROM sys.objects) AS SEQUENCE
    GROUP BY SEQUENCE.DAY) DQ

TRUNCATE TABLE [gold].[Account_Details_Dim]
TRUNCATE TABLE [gold].[customer_dim]
TRUNCATE TABLE gold.Fact_table
TRUNCATE TABLE gold.investor_dim
TRUNCATE TABLE gold.Loan_Defaulter_Dim
TRUNCATE TABLE gold.Loan_Details_Dim
TRUNCATE TABLE gold.Payment_Details_Dim

drop table bronze.watermark_table

create table bronze.watermark_table
(
    id int,
    tablename VARCHAR(50),
    idtracker int,
    LastModifytime date
);

insert into bronze.watermark_table (id,tablename, idtracker,LastModifytime) 
VALUES (1,'customer_data', 130772,  '2023-03-23' )
insert into bronze.watermark_table (id,tablename, idtracker,LastModifytime) 
VALUES (2,'investor_data', 130772,  '2023-03-23' )
insert into bronze.watermark_table (id, tablename, idtracker,LastModifytime) 
VALUES (3,'loan_details', 130772,  '2023-03-23' )

select * from bronze.watermark_table

from pyspark.sql.window import Window

from pyspark.sql.types import DecimalType

                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://temp-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temporary-staging")

# Adding the loan_id column
df_fact = df_fact.withColumn("loan_id",row_number() \

### Using withColumns in pyspark to concat string to ID columns
## Writing the cleaned and transformed data to gold table
## Checking the loan_details dataset for null value presence

# Add required imports
import com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics
from com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics.Constants import Constants
from pyspark.sql.functions import col
import pandas as pd

# Read from existing internal table
df_loan_details = (spark.read
                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://temp-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temporary-staging")
                     .synapsesql("LC_DWH.bronze.loan_details")

# Creating a dataframe to display percentage of null values in each column
a = pd.DataFrame()
a['Percentage of null values']=['10% or less','20% or less','30% or less','40% or less','50% or less','60% or less','70% or less']

ten_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.1])
twenty_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.2])
thirty_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.3])
fourty_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.4])
fifty_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.5])
sixty_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.6])
seventy_percent = len(df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.7])

# Considering only those columns which have null values less than 40% in that particular column
df = df_loan_details_pd[df_loan_details_pd.columns[((df_loan_details_pd.isnull().sum())/len(df_loan_details_pd)) < 0.4]]
df.shape

# Instead of checking every column of 53 columns like above, here we are running a for loop on top of 'object' columns 
# and take a decison based on the output of this cell.
for i in df_loan_details_pd.columns[df_loan_details_pd.dtypes == 'object']:
    print(df_loan_details_pd[i].value_counts())
    print('************************')

# (df.write
#  # If `Constants.SERVER` is not provided, the `<database_name>` from the three-part table name argument
#  # to `synapsesql` method is used to infer the Synapse Dedicated SQL End Point.
#  # .option(Constants.SERVER, "lendingclubwspace.sql.azuresynapse.net")
#  # if `Constants.TEMP_FOLDER` is not provided, the connector will use the runtime staging directory config (see section on Configuration Options for details).
#  .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://fs-lendingclub-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temp_staging")
#  .mode("overwrite")
#  # Required parameter - Three-part table name to which data will be written
#  .synapsesql("LC_DWH.gold.customer_dim", Constants.INTERNAL))
## Query to find the total count of customers by state and country

# Add required imports
import com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics
from com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics.Constants import Constants
from pyspark.sql.functions import avg, count,col,when,countDistinct,round, filter

# Read from existing internal table
df_customer_dim = (spark.read
                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://fs-lendingclub-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temp_staging")
                     .synapsesql("LC_DWH.gold.customer_dim")
                     # Column-pruning i.e., query select column values.
                    )

# Show contents of the dataframe
df_customer_dim.show()
### Query to find the average age of customers by state and country using pyspark dataframe
#Query to find the average age of customers by state and country using pyspark dataframe
customer_avg_age=spark.sql("SELECT state, country, count(*) as total_count FROM customer_details GROUP BY state, country")
### Query to find the number of customers with a premium status of "true" in each country, grouped by age range

#Query to find the number of customers with a premium status of "true" in each country, grouped by age range using pyspark dataframe:

customer_age_range=spark.sql("SELECT country, CASE WHEN age BETWEEN 18 AND 25 THEN 'Youngsters' \
           WHEN age BETWEEN 26 AND 35 THEN 'Working class' \
           WHEN age BETWEEN 36 AND 45 THEN 'Middle Age' \
           ELSE 'Senior Citizens' \
       END as age_range, \
       COUNT(*) \
 FROM customer_details \
WHERE prm_status = 'TRUE' \
GROUP BY country, age_range")
### Query to find the percentage of customers in each state that are premium customers, grouped by country

# --Query to find the percentage of customers in each state that are premium customers, grouped by country:

member_percentage_df = spark.sql(" \
WITH customer_counts AS ( \
    SELECT country, state, COUNT(*) as total_customers \
    FROM customer_details \
    GROUP BY country, state \
), \
member_counts AS ( \
    SELECT country, state, COUNT(DISTINCT member_id) as total_members \
    FROM customer_details \
    WHERE member_id IS NOT NULL and  prm_status = 'TRUE' \
    GROUP BY country, state \
) \
SELECT customer_counts.country, customer_counts.state, \
       ROUND(member_counts.total_members / customer_counts.total_customers * 100, 2) as member_percentage \
FROM customer_counts \
JOIN member_counts \
ON customer_counts.country = member_counts.country AND customer_counts.state = member_counts.state \

# Read from existing internal table
df_payment_details_dim = (spark.read
                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://fs-lendingclub-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temp_staging")
                     .synapsesql("LC_DWH.gold.Payment_Details_Dim")
                     # Column-pruning i.e., query select column values.
                    )

# Show contents of the dataframe
df_payment_details_dim.show()

unacceptable_grade="F"
very_bad_grade="E"
bad_grade="D"
good_grade="C"
very_good_grade="B"
excellent_grade="A"

payment_last_df = spark.sql("select c.member_id, c.state, c.country, c.first_name, c.last_name, \
  case \
    when p.last_pymnt_amnt < (p.installment * 0.5) then ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    when p.last_pymnt_amnt >= (p.installment * 0.5) and p.last_pymnt_amnt < p.installment then ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    when (p.last_pymnt_amnt = (p.installment)) then ${spark.sql.good_rated_pts} \
    when p.last_pymnt_amnt > (p.installment) and p.last_pymnt_amnt <= (p.installment * 1.50) then ${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts} \
    when p.last_pymnt_amnt > (p.installment * 1.50) then ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
    else ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
  end as last_payment_pts, \
  case \
    when p.total_pymnt >= (p.funded_amnt_inv * 0.50) then ${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts} \
    when p.total_pymnt < (p.funded_amnt_inv * 0.50) and p.total_pymnt > 0 then ${spark.sql.good_rated_pts} \
    when p.total_pymnt = 0 or (p.total_pymnt) is null then ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
    end as total_payment_pts \
from payment_details p \
inner join customer_details c on c.member_id = p.member_id")
spark.sql("select * from payment_points_df where last_payment_pts!= 500 or total_payment_pts!=500 ").show(7)
### Reading data from Loan Defaulter Dimension Table

# Read from existing internal table
df_loan_defaulter_dim = (spark.read
                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://fs-lendingclub-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temp_staging")
                     .synapsesql("LC_DWH.gold.Loan_Defaulter_Dim")
                     # Column-pruning i.e., query select column values.
                    )

# Show contents of the dataframe

loan_default_pts = spark.sql(
    "SELECT p.*, \
    CASE \
    WHEN l.delinq_2yrs = 0 THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.delinq_2yrs BETWEEN 1 AND 2 THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.delinq_2yrs BETWEEN 3 AND 5 THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.delinq_2yrs > 5 OR l.delinq_2yrs IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
    END AS delinq_pts, \
    CASE \
    WHEN l.pub_rec = 0 THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.pub_rec BETWEEN 1 AND 2 THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.pub_rec BETWEEN 3 AND 5 THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.pub_rec > 5 OR l.pub_rec IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    END AS pub_rec_pts, \
    CASE \
    WHEN l.pub_rec_bankruptcies = 0 THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}  \
    WHEN l.pub_rec_bankruptcies BETWEEN 1 AND 2 THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.pub_rec_bankruptcies BETWEEN 3 AND 5 THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.pub_rec_bankruptcies > 5 OR l.pub_rec_bankruptcies IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
    END AS public_bankruptcies_pts, \
    CASE \
    WHEN l.inq_last_6mths = 0 THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.inq_last_6mths BETWEEN 1 AND 2 THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.inq_last_6mths BETWEEN 3 AND 5 THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.inq_last_6mths > 5 OR l.inq_last_6mths IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
    END AS enq_pts, \
    CASE \
    WHEN l.hardship_flag = 'N' THEN ${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts} \
    WHEN l.hardship_flag = 'Y' OR l.hardship_flag IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
    END AS hardship_pts \
    FROM loan_default_details l \
    LEFT JOIN payment_points_df p ON p.member_id = l.member_id"

# Read from existing internal table

                     .option(Constants.TEMP_FOLDER, "abfss://fs-lendingclub-staging@lendingclubadlsgen2.dfs.core.windows.net/temp_staging")

                     # Column-pruning i.e., query select column values.
                    )

financial_df = spark.sql(
    "SELECT ldef.*, \
    CASE \
        WHEN LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%fully paid%' THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%current%' THEN ${spark.sql.good_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%in grace period%' THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%late (16-30 days)%' OR LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%late (31-120 days)%' THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(l.loan_status) LIKE '%charged off%' THEN ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts} \
    END AS loan_status_pts, \
    CASE \
        WHEN LOWER(a.home_ownership) LIKE '%own%' THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(a.home_ownership) LIKE '%rent%' THEN ${spark.sql.good_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(a.home_ownership) LIKE '%mortgage%' THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts} \
        WHEN LOWER(a.home_ownership) LIKE '%any%' OR LOWER(a.home_ownership) IS NULL THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts} \
    END AS home_pts,  \
    CASE \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt <= (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.10) THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt > (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.10) AND l.funded_amnt <= (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.20)  THEN ${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt > (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.20) AND l.funded_amnt <= (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.30)  THEN ${spark.sql.good_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt > (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.30) AND l.funded_amnt <= (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.50)  THEN ${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt > (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.50) AND l.funded_amnt <= (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.70)  THEN ${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN l.funded_amnt > (a.tot_hi_cred_lim * 0.70) THEN ${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts}  \
    END AS credit_limit_pts, \
    CASE \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='A' and (a.sub_grade)='A1' THEN ${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='A' and (a.sub_grade)='A2' THEN (${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}* 0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='A' and (a.sub_grade)='A3' THEN (${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}* 0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='A' and (a.sub_grade)='A4' THEN (${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}* 0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='A' and (a.sub_grade)='A5' THEN (${spark.sql.excellent_rated_pts}* 0.20)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='B' and (a.sub_grade)='B1' THEN (${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts})  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='B' and (a.sub_grade)='B2' THEN (${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts}* 0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='B' and (a.sub_grade)='B3' THEN (${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts}* 0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='B' and (a.sub_grade)='B4' THEN (${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts}* 0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='B' and (a.sub_grade)='B5' THEN (${spark.sql.very_good_rated_pts}* 0.20)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='C' and (a.sub_grade)='C1' THEN (${spark.sql.good_rated_pts})  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='C' and (a.sub_grade)='C2' THEN (${spark.sql.good_rated_pts}* 0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='C' and (a.sub_grade)='C3' THEN (${spark.sql.good_rated_pts}* 0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='C' and (a.sub_grade)='C4' THEN (${spark.sql.good_rated_pts}* 0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='C' and (a.sub_grade)='C5' THEN (${spark.sql.good_rated_pts}* 0.20)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='D' and (a.sub_grade)='D1' THEN (${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts})  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='D' and (a.sub_grade)='D2' THEN (${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts}*0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='D' and (a.sub_grade)='D3' THEN (${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts}*0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='D' and (a.sub_grade)='D4' THEN (${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts}*0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='D' and (a.sub_grade)='D5' THEN (${spark.sql.bad_rated_pts}*0.20)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='E' and (a.sub_grade)='E1' THEN (${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts})  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='E' and (a.sub_grade)='E2' THEN (${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts}*0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='E' and (a.sub_grade)='E3' THEN (${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts}*0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='E' and (a.sub_grade)='E4' THEN (${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts}*0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) ='E' and (a.sub_grade)='E5' THEN (${spark.sql.very_bad_rated_pts}*0.20)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) in ('F','G') and (a.sub_grade) in ('F1','G1') THEN (${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts})  \
        WHEN (a.grade) in ('F','G') and (a.sub_grade) in ('F2','G2') THEN (${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts}*0.80)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) in ('F','G') and (a.sub_grade) in ('F3','G3') THEN (${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts}*0.60)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) in ('F','G') and (a.sub_grade) in ('F4','G4') THEN (${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts}*0.40)  \
        WHEN (a.grade) in ('F','G') and (a.sub_grade) in ('F5','G5') THEN (${spark.sql.unacceptable_rated_pts}*0.20)  \
    END AS grade_pts \
 FROM loan_default_points_df ldef \
 LEFT JOIN loan_details l ON ldef.member_id = l.member_id \
 LEFT JOIN account_details a ON a.member_id = ldef.member_id")

loan_score = spark.sql("SELECT member_id, first_name, last_name, state, country, \
((last_payment_pts+total_payment_pts)*0.20) as payment_history_pts, \
((delinq_pts +pub_rec_pts+public_bankruptcies_pts+enq_pts+hardship_pts)*0.45) as defaulters_history_pts, \
((loan_status_pts+home_pts+credit_limit_pts+grade_pts)*0.35) as financial_health_pts \
FROM loan_score_details")

loan_score_final=spark.sql("select ls.*, \
case \
WHEN loan_score > ${spark.sql.very_good_grade_pts} THEN '" + excellent_grade + "' \
WHEN loan_score <= ${spark.sql.very_good_grade_pts} AND loan_score > ${spark.sql.good_grade_pts} THEN '" + very_good_grade + "' \
WHEN loan_score <= ${spark.sql.good_grade_pts} AND loan_score > ${spark.sql.bad_grade_pts} THEN '" + good_grade + "' \
WHEN loan_score <= ${spark.sql.bad_grade_pts} AND loan_score > ${spark.sql.very_bad_grade_pts} THEN '" + bad_grade + "' \
WHEN loan_score <= ${spark.sql.very_bad_grade_pts} AND loan_score > ${spark.sql.unacceptable_grade_pts} THEN '" + very_bad_grade + "' \
WHEN loan_score <= ${spark.sql.unacceptable_grade_pts} THEN '" + unacceptable_grade + "' \
end as loan_final_grade \
from loan_score_eval ls")
spark.sql("select * from loan_final_table where loan_final_grade in ('C') ").show()
